project.teaser: Discovering newest and enhanced forms to analyse and treat cancer is among the top national and international priorities (e.g. HEurope’s Mission on Cancer; Europe’s Beating Cancer Plan). PREDICTOS focus on the enhancement of the scientific and innovation excellence of...
project.objective: Discovering newest and enhanced forms to analyse and treat cancer is among the top national and international priorities (e.g. HEurope’s Mission on Cancer; Europe’s Beating Cancer Plan). PREDICTOS focus on the enhancement of the scientific and innovation excellence of CDRSP-PL (widening partner, PT) aiming at the exploration and development of innovative solutions for an improved treatment of osteosarcoma (OS) (the tumour that most affects the youngest, with lower cure success). By cooperating with three leading institutions (CNR, IT; MERLN, NL; ULIEGE, BE), this project will encompass various knowledge sharing and capacity building activities (e.g., short staff exchanges for researchers and management/ administrative staff; networking events and meetings; training sessions; organization of workshops, summer/winter schools; coaching and mentoring sessions gathering senior and junior researchers; publication of scientific articles, and participation in conferences and general public’s events. Also, the consortium will collaborate in an exploratory research project for develop and test 3D in vitro and in silico models to mimic OS, generating knowledge on novel therapeutic strategies to eliminate cancer cells. PREDICTOS expects to benefit directly +400 senior and junior researchers and administrative staff from partners’ institutions, to involve +80 relevant stakeholders from Academia, Industry and Policy-Making in networking activities and to reach +10.000 individuals through dissemination and communication activities. PREDICTOS is, in this way, aligned with the expected outcomes and impacts from Twinning Call and Destination, contributing to bridge the research and innovation gap between the European entities, improve research management and administrative skills, raise entities reputation and research excellence, and stimulate institutions to join efforts and co-innovate and establish more strategic research approaches and cooperation.
project.title: Strengthening excellence for advanced osteosarcoma’s predictive models
project.keywords: Biomanufacturing, Biomimicry, In Vitro, 3D Digital Technology, In Silico, Magnetic Stimulation, Osteosarcoma, Cancer, Therapy, Coaching and mentoring, Capacity building, Innovation ecosystem

result.title: Magnetic-responsive materials tailored to enhance the cascade of bone regeneration and immune response

details.authors: Ana Catarina Almeida, Diana Pacheco, Artur Mateus, Monica Montesi, Silvia Panseri, Nuno Alves, Simone Sprio, Tatiana M. Fernandes Patrício

result.title: Effectiveness of Viscolma as suitable platform for bone tissue regeneration

details.authors: Pacheco, D., Almeida, A.C., Alves, N., Mateus, A., Mota, C. Patrício, T. M. F.
details.journalTitle: Stronger together: embracing the power of interdisciplinarity in tissue engineering

result.title: Management and Coordination Handbook
result.description: Guide with information on the consortium members, committees, project management and coordination procedures, reporting procedures, internal communication policies, templates to be used within the project, and tools to be used to ensure a smooth project implementation. Deliverable related to Task 1.1.

result.title: Communication, dissemination and outreach: plan
result.description: Communication, dissemination and outreach plan of the project. Deliverable related to Task 5.1.

result.title: Strategic Research Agenda and Funding Roadmap - 1
result.description: Strategic Research Agenda (SRA) designed based on the competencies of the consortium. It will include also the results of an analysis on the available opportunities for exploitation actions, such as funding programmes. The results of the cooperation actions with S&T entities and the industry will be also included. Deliverable related to Tasks 2.1 and 2.2.

result.title: PREDICTOS Diversity illustration: tools and guidelines
result.description: Document detailing the tools and providing guidelines to measure the diversity balance and equal access in the project activities. Deliverable related to Task 1.4.

result.title: PREDICTOS Progress report
result.description: Interim report addressing the progress of the project accomplished: status on objectives, KPI and milestones achievements; scientific and non-scientific accomplishments; activities performed; risk assessment; plan for the next period... Deliverable related to Task 1.1.

result.title: Ethics and Data Management Plan - 1
result.description: Plan that will define the ethical standards to be followed by the project and detail how data will be managed by the project, in compliance with EU best practices and requirements. It will follow the template available for DMP for HE projects, focusing the first part on data related issues, and the second part on other ethics issues if pertinent. Deliverable related to Task 1.3.

result.title: Sustainability and Exploitation Strategy - 1
result.description: Sustainability and Exploitation Strategy containing the project plan concerning the results exploitation and sustainability. Deliverable related to Task 5.4.

result.title: Quality Assurance and Risk Management Plan
result.description: Plan to guarantee the overall quality monitoring process, with a focus on the review process of deliverables, annual reports and milestones completion. It also includes the identification of potential risks and mitigation strategies. It will be kept as a living document and updated over the course of the project whenever significant changes arise. On M13, deep analysis and assessment will be performed to assess the validity of the plan, which shall be updated if necessary. Deliverable related to Task 1.2.

result.title: Communication, dissemination and outreach: first period report and plan update
result.description: Report on the communication, dissemination and outreach activities performed by the project in the first period (related to Tasks 5.2 and 5.3), and update to the plan presented in D5.1 (related to Task 5.1).

result.title: Short Term Staff Exchanges Report (activities and evaluation) - First Period
result.description: Report on the Short Term Staff Exchanges (inwards & outwards) (first period), including insights from the reports produced by the researchers enrolled in the secondments, as well as a report on the experts visits. Deliverable related to Task 4.1.

category.title: Digital agenda
category.description: This tracker monitors Horizon Europe’s financial contribution to the development of digital technologies and the digitisation of the economy and society (known as ‘Digital transition’).

category.title: Clean air
category.description: This tracker monitors the Horizon Europe’s financial contribution to the clean air policy (National Emission Ceiling Directive) aiming to improve ambient air quality and tackle air pollution, to protect the environment and human health.

category.title: Artificial intelligence
category.description: This tracker monitors Horizon Europe’s financial contribution to the development and deployment of AI-based technologies and solutions. Projects that develop AI-tools as part of their research method are included

category.title: Climate action
category.description: This tracker monitors the Horizon Europe’s financial contribution to both mitigating climate change (e.g., contributions to the reduction of greenhouse gas emissions) and adapting to climate change by building resilience (e.g., regarding floods, droughts, spatial planning and better governance, adaptation to changing climate in value chains, etc.).

category.title: Biodiversity
category.description: This tracker monitors the Horizon Europe’s financial contribution to Europe’s biodiversity’s path to recovery including species protection, ecosystem conservation, and habitat rehabilitation, all essential for resilience in climate adaptation and addressing ecosystem services but also environmental crime and the health-environment connection.
